com.jumio

Class MobileSDK

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jumio.MobileSDK
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuthenticationSDK, BamSDK, DocumentVerificationSDK, NetverifySDK

    public abstract class MobileSDK
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for all Jumio products.

    • Method Detail

      • recreate

        public void recreate(android.app.Activity rootActivity)
        This should only be called in case the hosting activity gets recreated
        Parameters:
        rootActivity - reference to the new activity

      • getSDKVersion

        public static java.lang.String getSDKVersion()
        Returns the Mobile SDK version.
        Returns:
        Jumio Mobile SDK version

      • isRooted

        public static boolean isRooted(android.content.Context context)
        Checks if the device is rooted
        Returns:
        is rooted or not

      • setCustomTheme

        public void setCustomTheme(int themeResourceId)
        Sets a custom theme for the SDK. Overrides the theme, that is defined in the manifest
        Parameters:
        themeResourceId - the resource id of the theme to be set

      • getRequiredPermissions

        public static java.lang.String[] getRequiredPermissions()
        Obtain all "dangerous" permissions that are required by the Jumio SDK. As of Android 6.0+ all "dangerous" permissions must be acquired dynamically.
        Returns:
        An array of Strings, where each element identifies exactly one permission that implementors must acquire.
        See Also:
        Android permissions api, Android system permissions

      • hasAllRequiredPermissions

        public static boolean hasAllRequiredPermissions(android.content.Context context)
        Checks if all required permissions are already granted.
        Parameters:
        context - The context object on which to check
        Returns:
        true if all necessary permissions for the SDK are granted, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        getRequiredPermissions() to get all permission identifiers needed, getMissingPermissions() to get all permissions, which are not yet granted

      • hasPermissionsFor

        public static boolean hasPermissionsFor(android.content.Context context,
                                        java.lang.String[] names)
        Check if certain permissions have already been granted.
        Parameters:
        context - The context for which to check
        names - An array of strings containing the identifiers for each permission.
        Returns:
        true, if all permissions have been granted, false if at least one permission is not yet granted.

      • getMissingPermissions

        public static java.lang.String[] getMissingPermissions(android.content.Context context)
        Returns a list containing each permission (as String), which is needed by the SDK but not yet granted for the given Context.
        Parameters:
        context - The context object to check for
        Returns:
        A list, where each element identifies a missing permission. An empty list if all permissions are already granted.

      • start

        public abstract void start()
                    throws MissingPermissionException
        Throws:
        MissingPermissionException
